importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the announcement of Doug Martin's death, indicating the timing of the public revelation of this news.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: Martin's prime NFL years, including his Pro Bowl appearances and All-Pro recognition, which define the peak of his professional career.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at age 36.
Martin was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft after a standout college career at Boise State.
He rushed for 5,356 yards and 30 touchdowns in his NFL career across six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.
Martin recorded 148 catches for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns.
He earned a Pro Bowl berth in 2012 and was named first-team All-Pro in 2015.
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers issued a statement expressing deep sorrow over his passing and acknowledged his lasting impact on the franchise.
Martin was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers franchise history during their 50th-anniversary celebration.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36. Selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft after a standout college career at Boise State, Martin had a successful professional career with the Buccaneers, rushing for 5,356 yards and 30 touchdowns, and earning Pro Bowl and first-team All-Pro honors in 2015. He also played one season with the Raiders. The Buccaneers acknowledged his lasting impact on the franchise and named him among the top 50 players in team history during their 50th-anniversary celebration.
title: Former Buccaneers All-Pro Running Back Doug Martin Dies at 36
